issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Journal Nodes should refuse to format non-empty directories

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: HDFS-11112 completely restricted to re-format journalnode, but it should be allowed when *"-force"* option is given. If user feel force option can accidentally delete the data then he can disable it by configuring "*dfs.reformat.disabled*"
fields.summary: Journal Nodes should allow to format non-empty directories with "-force" option

comments.body:
We see this issue in our Windows deployment.
I thought it was a Windows exclusive only.
If we add the force option, I'd like to make sure it works for Windows.
Hi [~surendrasingh], just for my curiosity, what is the use case for reformatting JNs?
Hi [~arpitagarwal], when we want to recover the NN with old backuped fsimage, we need to reinitialized the share edits to avoid the mismatch between fsimage and edits logs.
Attached initial patch, pls review..
[~elgoiri], I run the test code in windows. it is working.

This message was automatically generated.
I haven't seen {{TestQuorumJournalManagerUnit}} before, it must be related.
I don't like wiping all JNs with a single mis-executed command. This is a rare scenario so it it's probably safer for the admin to manually wipe JNs.

bq. I don't like wiping all JNs with a single mis-executed command.

Sure, but as it is right now, we are letting the NNs being reimaged already.
Another option it's to add an extra flag like the transitionToActive which includes forceManual.

If you guys think this is a must fix, then go ahead.

Personally I feel that force format is a bad feature. :) In any situation where the cluster must be genuinely re-imaged it's not too much to ask that the admin wipe master nodes separately.

[~elgoiri], TestQuorumJournalManagerUnit  is related to this patch only. I will fix it. 

We will check with other guys also for there opinion.

[~vinayrpet], [~brahmareddy], [~ajisakaa] What do you think about this fix ?

Thanks [~vinayrpet] for review and your comment.
I updated the patch and fixed the review comments.
